ej.wadapps.storage

Interface Storage


  • public interface Storage
    Defines the storage mechanism.

    The storage use an identifier to store, retrieve or remove a data. An identifier is an unlimited-length sequence (greater than 0) of letters, digits and special characters, the first of which must be a letter. The "letters" includes lowercase(a-z), uppercase(A-Z) ASCII latin characters and ASCII underscore(_). The "digits" includes the ASCII digit(0-9). The special characters includes ASCII hyphen(-) and ASCII dot(.).

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Tests whether a data exists for this ID.

      Stores an input stream that will be referenced with an ID.

    • Method Detail

      • store

        void store(String id,
           InputStream stream)
    throws IOException
        Stores an input stream that will be referenced with an ID.

        If a data is already stored with this ID, it is overwritten.

        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the stored data.
        stream - the data to be stored.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given ID is not a valid identifier.
        NullPointerException - if one of the given parameters is null.

      • load

        InputStream load(String id)
          throws IOException
        Returns the data stored with a specific ID or null if there is none.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the data to be returned.
        Returns:
        the data stored with the given ID or null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given ID is not a valid identifier.
        NullPointerException - if one of the given parameters is null.

      • move

        void move(String src,
          String dst)
   throws IOException
        Changes the ID of a data.

        If a data is already stored with the new ID, it is overwritten.

        Parameters:
        src - the old ID of the data.
        dst - the new ID of the data.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        IllegalArgumentException - if one of the given IDs is not a valid identifier.
        IllegalArgumentException - if there is no data stored with the old ID.
        NullPointerException - if one of the given parameters is null.

      • remove

        void remove(String id)
     throws IOException
        Removes the data stored with an ID.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the data to return.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given ID is not a valid identifier.
        IllegalArgumentException - if there is no data stored with the given ID.
        NullPointerException - if one of the given parameters is null.

      • exists

        boolean exists(String id)
        throws IOException
        Tests whether a data exists for this ID.
        Parameters:
        id - the storage-key to check.
        Returns:
        true if the given ID exists, false otherwise
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • getIds

        String[] getIds()
         throws IOException
        Returns all IDs of the stored data.
        Returns:
        an array of all IDs.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
